trans-unit.source: Get Operation Status
trans-unit.target: Get Operation Status

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> operation returns the status of the specified operation.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> operation returns the status of the specified operation.

trans-unit.source: After calling an asynchronous operation, you can call <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> to determine whether the operation has succeeded, failed, or is still in progress.
trans-unit.target: After calling an asynchronous operation, you can call <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> to determine whether the operation has succeeded, failed, or is still in progress.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;request-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the request ID that was returned in a response.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;request-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the request ID that was returned in a response.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: GET
trans-unit.target: GET

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: This header should be set to <userInput>2009-10-01</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: This header should be set to <userInput>2009-10-01</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is in progress, or has failed.
trans-unit.target: The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is in progress, or has failed.

trans-unit.source: This status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> operation itself.
trans-unit.target: This status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> operation itself.

trans-unit.source: If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request.
trans-unit.target: If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request.

trans-unit.source: If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request, and also includes error information regarding the failure.
trans-unit.target: If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request, and also includes error information regarding the failure.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements in the response body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements in the response body.

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ID
trans-unit.target: ID

trans-unit.source: Specifies the request ID of the asynchronous request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the request ID of the asynchronous request.

trans-unit.source: This value is returned in the <parameterReference>x-ms-request-id</parameterReference> response header of the asynchronous request.
trans-unit.target: This value is returned in the <parameterReference>x-ms-request-id</parameterReference> response header of the asynchronous request.

trans-unit.source: Status
trans-unit.target: Status

trans-unit.source: Specifies the status of the asynchronous request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the status of the asynchronous request.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: HttpStatusCode
trans-unit.target: HttpStatusCode

trans-unit.source: Specifies the HTTP status code for the asynchronous request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the HTTP status code for the asynchronous request.

trans-unit.source: Code
trans-unit.target: Code

trans-unit.source: Specifies the management service error code returned if the asynchronous request failed.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the management service error code returned if the asynchronous request failed.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Status and Error Codes</link> for information about possible error codes returned by the service.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Status and Error Codes</link> for information about possible error codes returned by the service.

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: Specifies the management service error message returned if the asynchronous request failed.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the management service error message returned if the asynchronous request failed.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Service management operations that require lengthy processing to complete are implemented with an asynchronous pattern.
trans-unit.target: Service management operations that require lengthy processing to complete are implemented with an asynchronous pattern.

trans-unit.source: All successful Service Management REST API operation requests return a unique request ID, which can be used to determine the final status of an operation.
trans-unit.target: All successful Service Management REST API operation requests return a unique request ID, which can be used to determine the final status of an operation.

trans-unit.source: This is done by polling <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> with the request ID until the operation has succeeded or failed.
trans-unit.target: This is done by polling <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> with the request ID until the operation has succeeded or failed.

trans-unit.source: An asynchronous service management operation request will return quickly.
trans-unit.target: An asynchronous service management operation request will return quickly.

trans-unit.source: An error response to the asynchronous operation request indicates that the request did not succeed, and no asynchronous operation is pending.
trans-unit.target: An error response to the asynchronous operation request indicates that the request did not succeed, and no asynchronous operation is pending.

trans-unit.source: An operation request will return a status code of 202 (Accepted) to indicate that the request has been made successfully and is pending.
trans-unit.target: An operation request will return a status code of 202 (Accepted) to indicate that the request has been made successfully and is pending.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> operation will return an error status code and an error response body if the call to <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> does not succeed, for example, if the request ID does not correspond to an actual service management operation request made against your subscription.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> operation will return an error status code and an error response body if the call to <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> does not succeed, for example, if the request ID does not correspond to an actual service management operation request made against your subscription.

trans-unit.source: A status code of 200 (OK) indicates that the <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> call has been made successfully, and the status of the operation specified by the request ID parameter is recorded in the response body returned.
trans-unit.target: A status code of 200 (OK) indicates that the <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> call has been made successfully, and the status of the operation specified by the request ID parameter is recorded in the response body returned.

trans-unit.source: You must check the response body for the status of the asynchronous operation.
trans-unit.target: You must check the response body for the status of the asynchronous operation.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Operation</languageKeyword> element or the response body contains a <languageKeyword>Status</languageKeyword> element value representing the current state of the pending operation, which can be <codeInline>InProgress</codeInline>, <codeInline>Failed</codeInline>, or <codeInline>Succeeded</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Operation</languageKeyword> element or the response body contains a <languageKeyword>Status</languageKeyword> element value representing the current state of the pending operation, which can be <codeInline>InProgress</codeInline>, <codeInline>Failed</codeInline>, or <codeInline>Succeeded</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Continue polling <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> while the <languageKeyword>Status</languageKeyword> element contains <codeInline>InProgress</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Continue polling <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> while the <languageKeyword>Status</languageKeyword> element contains <codeInline>InProgress</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: When the <languageKeyword>Status</languageKeyword> element has a value of <codeInline>Succeeded</codeInline> or <codeInline>Failed</codeInline>, the <languageKeyword>Operation</languageKeyword> element will also contain an <languageKeyword>HttpStatusCode</languageKeyword> element containing the status code for the completed asynchronous operation.
trans-unit.target: When the <languageKeyword>Status</languageKeyword> element has a value of <codeInline>Succeeded</codeInline> or <codeInline>Failed</codeInline>, the <languageKeyword>Operation</languageKeyword> element will also contain an <languageKeyword>HttpStatusCode</languageKeyword> element containing the status code for the completed asynchronous operation.

trans-unit.source: If the <languageKeyword>Status</languageKeyword> element contains <codeInline>Failed</codeInline>, the <languageKeyword>Operation</languageKeyword> element will contain an <languageKeyword>Error</languageKeyword> element with <languageKeyword>Code</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>Message</languageKeyword> elements giving further details on the asynchronous operation error.
trans-unit.target: If the <languageKeyword>Status</languageKeyword> element contains <codeInline>Failed</codeInline>, the <languageKeyword>Operation</languageKeyword> element will contain an <languageKeyword>Error</languageKeyword> element with <languageKeyword>Code</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>Message</languageKeyword> elements giving further details on the asynchronous operation error.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: This example console program creates a new storage account, setting the description, label, and location using the <link xlink:href="c0e41451-d6e5-43e3-9443-367dc4e3520b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Storage Account</link> operation, then polls the <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> operation with the request ID returned from the <link xlink:href="c0e41451-d6e5-43e3-9443-367dc4e3520b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Storage Account</link> operation until the call has succeeded, failed, or polling has timed out.
trans-unit.target: This example console program creates a new storage account, setting the description, label, and location using the <link xlink:href="c0e41451-d6e5-43e3-9443-367dc4e3520b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Storage Account</link> operation, then polls the <languageKeyword>Get Operation Status</languageKeyword> operation with the request ID returned from the <link xlink:href="c0e41451-d6e5-43e3-9443-367dc4e3520b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Storage Account</link> operation until the call has succeeded, failed, or polling has timed out.

trans-unit.source: Finally, it calls <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link> to display the properties for the new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Finally, it calls <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link> to display the properties for the new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Set the value for the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header in the <codeInline>Version</codeInline> string, your subscription identifier in <codeInline>SubscriptionId</codeInline>, your management certificate thumbprint in <codeInline>Thumbprint</codeInline>, and set <codeInline>ServiceName</codeInline> to a unique storage account name to run the sample.
trans-unit.target: Set the value for the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header in the <codeInline>Version</codeInline> string, your subscription identifier in <codeInline>SubscriptionId</codeInline>, your management certificate thumbprint in <codeInline>Thumbprint</codeInline>, and set <codeInline>ServiceName</codeInline> to a unique storage account name to run the sample.

trans-unit.source: This example program produces console output something like the following when run:
trans-unit.target: This example program produces console output something like the following when run:
